label: A2B3C2_cI28_199_a_b_a-002
title: Corderoite ($\alpha$-Hg$_{3}$S$_{2}$Cl$_{2}$) Structure
comments:
Hg$_{3}$Cl$_{2}$S$_{2}$ is found in three forms (Carlson, 1967): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C2_cI28_199_a_b_a-002}{Corderoite ($\alpha$-Hg$_{3}$Cl$_{2}$S$_{2}$)}, the cubic ground state. (this structure) \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C2_cP224_223_abcdefk_j3k_il-001}{$\beta$-Hg$_{3}$Cl$_{2}$S$_{2}$}, which appears above 340$^{\circ}$C, another cubic phase with a much larger unit cell. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C_oP16_51_2e_bfi_j-001}{Kenhsuite ($\gamma$-Hg$_{3}$Cl$_{2}$S$_{2}$)}, which on average has an orthorhombic lattice.  This state is apparently metastable. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 Corderoite is a cubic variant of the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C_oP8_51_e_be_f-001}{parkerite (Ni$_{3}$Bi$_{2}$S$_{2}$) structure}.
